Clothing and Jewelery designs are sorted first by body location

  • Head Hat/helm
  • Neck Necklace/brooch/Cloakpin
  • Torso Shirt/Vest/Breastplate/Robe
  • Cloak
  • Hands gloves/Rings/gauntlets
  • Wrists Bracelets/bracers
  • Waist Belt
  • Legs Pants/kilt/skirt/Leggings/tights/Greaves
  • Feet Boots
  • Piercings

The default assumption is that clothing is designed as a physical defense- armor. Clothing with other purposes can be designed through proper modification.

Many values of benefits and penalties are divided by a "slot" modifier, reducing their impact for smaller areas of coverage. Similarly, maximums are multiplied by such a modifier to reduce their effect as well.

Item Modifiers

see Inventory

These caluculations are done after all other modifiers and modifications are applied.

ModifiersTypes
1 (normal)Vest/Breastplate, Pants/kilt
.75Shirt, Leggings, Cloak
x.5Bracers/bracelets, Greaves, Hat/Helm, Belt
x.1Gloves, Gauntlets, Boots, Necklass, (Shoulder armor)
x.01Rings, Cloakpin, Brooch
  • Mobility divide by modifer
  • Bulk, Toughness and Hardness multiply by modifier


example; A crafter is considering creating the design for an item, the materials plus his desired adjustments to the difficulty give a set of stats that look like; mobility 10, bulk 50, toughness 63, hardness 6.3. If this item were a Vest/breastplate these remain unchanged, as a Cloak they become mobility 13 (rounded down from 13.33), bulk 37 (rounded down from 37.5), toughness 47 (rounded down from 47.25), and hardness 4.7. A helm would be mobility 20, bulk 25, toughness 31 (rounded down from 31.5), and hardness 3.1.

Base

Mobility equals Malleability, Quality is 100, and there are generally no automatic Skill Bonuses. Bulk equal to 10x Weight. Toughness equal to 101 minus the higher of Malleability or Fragility, with Durability and Hardness as 10 percent of that value (rounded up).

Modifications

Mobility

Each increase in mobility comes at the lower of the item's Malleability or (101-Fragility). Each such improvement increases the difficulty of the skill check to make the item by 10^(the number of such increases already performed).


The minimum Mobility of an item is 0, at which point the character recieves no base defense because of their effective 0 Agility.

example; A Malleability 10 Fragility 23 substance is to be made into armor for a character with an amazingly high Agility. The base mobility is 10 (the Malleability). Any change in Mobility will be done by increments of 10 (the substances Malleablity of 10 being lower than 78 {101 minus the 23 Fragility}). The first increase (from 10 to 20) increases the difficulty of checks by 1 (10^0, no previous increases having been attempted). A second increase (from 20 to 30) will bump the difficulty by 10 (10^1), for a total increase of 11. Third increase (30 to 40) makes the difficulty 100 points higher (10^2), for a total difficulty bump of 111... example 2; A Malleability 50 Fragility 78 substance is to be made into clothing. The character wants fine accoutrements, in which the wearer does not expect to fight. The base Mobility of the clothing is 50, and any adjustment will be done in units of 23 (101-the 78 Fragility being lower than the Malleability of 50). His first reduction of the clothing's Mobility (from 50 to 27) will bring a one point reduction in difficulty. The second reduction of the clothing's Mobility (from 27 to 4) provides an additional 10 points, for a total reduction in difficulty of 11. If he were willing to reduce the Mobility again (to 0) he would reduce the difficulty to produce the item by a total of 111 points, but the wearer would recieve no Agility for defense.

Bulk

Each reduction of Bulk comes at the lower of the item's Malleability or Weight. Each such improvement increases the difficulty of the skill check to make the item by 10^(the number of such increases already performed).

Bulk cannot be reduced below 0, nor can it be increased to more than 10x its base value.

Hardness

Each additional point of Hardness increases the difficulty by the higher of the substance's Malleability or Fragility.

Toughness

Each additional point of Toughness increases the difficulty by one tenth of the higher of the substance's Malleability or Fragility.

Bonuses

Various articals of clothing can grant bonuses to skills, especially the Bard and Merchant skill. Some items even give non-skill bonuses.

  • Generally, skill bonuses are rated by the amount of virtual Experience they grant in that skill. This experience benefits the character only when equipping that artical in a way that it can be used, and is lost when the item is unequipped or unusable. A 1 point penalty to the crafting skill checks are imposed for each point of experience in a combat skill, each two points of experience in a non-combat skill, or each three points of experience in a non-combat skill specialization.
  • Each point of virtual experience granted towards Charisma increases the difficulty of the item by 1.
  • Each storage slot adds 10 to the difficulty of the item. The maximum storage slots that can be created equals the lower of the items own size, in storage slots, or 10% of its malleability. These are treated as Locations for a belt worn in the "Belt" location.

Non-skill bonuses have varying values of their own.
